thread.title: Chelsea impressed by loan keeper Jamal Blackman's progress | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Chelsea impressed by loan keeper Jamal Blackman's progress | Daily Mail Online

author: Kieran Gill For Mailonline
title: Chelsea impressed by loan keeper Jamal Blackman's progress | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Chelsea's former first-team goalkeeping coach Christophe Lollichon has been keeping a close eye on Jamal Blackman with the Wycombe loanee aiming to challenge Thibaut Courtois. Blackman, whose Chelsea contract runs until 2019, is impressing in League Two and wants to be loaned out again next season at a higher level. The plan is for the 23-year-old to then try to compete for the No 1 spot from 2018 and Lollichon is reporting back good things on Blackman from his regular visits. Chelsea goalkeeper Jamal Blackman has been impressive while on loan at Wycombe Looking after the loanees is part of Lollichon's new duties since he stepped down from his role with the first team. Wycombe are pushing for promotion this season and currently sit in the League Two play-off positions. Former first-team goalkeeping coach Christophe Lollichon has been watching the youngster Blackman is part of the famous WhatsApp group that Chelsea's loanees use to keep in touch and was jokingly sent messages ahead of their game against Tottenham in the FA Cup. That saw Wycombe lose 4-3 as Spurs scored in the 89th and 97th minutes. RELATED ARTICLES
